6. During Sunset one sees many
different things appear red in color:
the ground, stones and bricks,
as well as the faces of People.
Where the Sun’s rays strike,
they create a clear reflection,
at once turning a blushing red,
fiery, and sharing in the glow.
left-middlePHow at sunset all things are redder in color.

7. Now when Phoebus, with his swift Horses,
runs to the great Ocean
to take up his lodging under the evening star,
one can see a shining streak in the Sea,
spreading up toward the land.
And in general, the water,
like a chameleon, is wont to take on the color
Of whatever is above or just next to it.

8. In the Sea or the water, translucent and limpid,
the mirror of the Sky in clear brightness,
one sees reflected, morning and night,
the blushing cheeks of Tithonus’ Bride,
full of love, and sees still better,
when Eolus’ troops do not occupy
the air with thick dark clouds,
preventing her from entry.
left-middleThe Sea or water, a mirror of the Sky.
left-middleOn Figures in the clouds through the Sun’s reflection.

9. Many times one sees Colors and Images
in the clouds, which multiply
or diminish in various ways,
depending on whether the material of fire
or the thickness of the clouds dominate them.
Now we still have to turn our subject
to a reflection in the clouds,
wondrous for all people to see.

10. Directly opposite the Sun,
more often in the Autumn, when the days are short,
there is displayed a half Ring,
or a semicircle, large and broadly dissolved,
as the Sun begins to sink or set,
then its height reaches its highest;
but lest I deprive you of its name,
I mean the many-hued Rainbow.
left-middleOn the Rainbow in the clouds, being a Reflection of the Sun.
